message_1: Suppose a village shares a common pasture that can support a maximum of 100 cows. There are two farmers, Farmer A and Farmer B, who use the pasture to graze their cows. If Farmer A grazes 40 cows and Farmer B grazes 30 cows, the pasture will be depleted and the cows will suffer. However, each farmer gains 10 dollars for each cow they graze. Assuming that each farmer acts independently to maximize their own personal profit, how many cows will Farmer A graze and how many cows will Farmer B graze?
